Protocol

Class CWPMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • Protocol.CWPMessage

  • public class CWPMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents messages of the custom protocol defined for this application. CWP stands for Collaborative Whiteboard Protocol. This class is used to create valid messages to be sent and received, having its own validation process. It is an immutable class.
    Author:
    Nicholas M. Mizoguchi

    • Constructor Detail

      • CWPMessage

        public CWPMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Constructor method.
        Parameters:
        message - A string that represents the message to be parsed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the message is invalid according to the CWProtocol.

    • Method Detail

      • Encode

        public static java.lang.String Encode(User user,
                      java.lang.String action,
                      java.lang.String[] params)
        Static method. Defines a message as a String.
        Parameters:
        user - The User object that represents the sender.
        action - The name of the action to be encoded.
        params - The parameters of the action.
        Returns:
        a String that represents the message to be sent through the socket.

      • EncodePaintAction

        public static java.lang.String EncodePaintAction(User user,
                                 java.lang.String paintAction)
        Static method. Defines a message as a String.
        Parameters:
        user - The User object that represents the sender.
        paintAction - The paint action, used by Whiteboard objects.
        Returns:
        a String that represents the message to be sent through the socket.

      • getSenderUID

        public java.lang.String getSenderUID()
        Returns:
        the UID from the Sender.

      • getAction

        public java.lang.String getAction()
        Returns:
        the action represented by this message.

      • getArgument

        public java.lang.String getArgument(int index)
        Return an argument of the message.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the argument. The index must be a non-zero integer less then the number of arguments. index 0 represents the first argument, and index n represents the n-1 argument.
        Returns:
        the argument in the position represented by the index.

      • getArguments

        public java.lang.String[] getArguments()
        Returns:
        an array of all arguments in the current message.

      • getPaintAction

        public java.lang.String getPaintAction()
        Requires that the message represents a paint action.
        Returns:
        the portion of the message that represents the paint action. This means removing the header of the message (such as sender UID).

      • getArgumentsSize

        public int getArgumentsSize()
        Returns:
        the number of arguments present in the current message.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the message as a string, that could be sent directly through a stream, since it has the format necessary to be parsed back to a CWPMessage object.
